text: Hello! I am a newbie to HubSpot and encountered some inappropriate behavior in the link field. I am using it in the menu module and when the link to the website content is passed the output is the same page on which the user is. For the external links,  it works correctly. And the same behavior is for the URL field. Are there any restrictions for using the link in the menu or am I doing sth wrong? `<a href="{{module.testimonial_link.url.href }}">See more</a>`

> I am using it in the menu module and when the link to the website content is passed the output is the same page on which the user is. For the external links, it works correctly.
I don’t understand this part of your question, sorry! Is the menu module a custom menu module or native HubSpot module? Maybe some screenshots and more context might help the community help you
I’d monitor and see if it happens again. Probably was a hiccup on HubSpot’s end
do you want the link to go in a new tab but it is appearing in the same tab? If so add target=“_blank” to the link

:sparkles:Slack Tips and Best Practices:sparkles:

To get the most out the HubSpot Developer Slack, follow these best practices:

• Will your post/question potentially help more than one person? Ask in a public channel instead of 1:1 DMs to help as many folks as possible. 
• Thread all replies to keep topics organized and searchable
• Thread followup questions/comments to your original post
• Don't post the same question in multiple channels. If you must, link to your original question in new channels.
More <https://slack.com/blog/collaboration/etiquette-tips-in-slack|great tips here>. Thanks for making the HubSpot Developer Slack easier to use for everyone!

Can someone help me understand Deal/Customer attribution for Ad manager.  Does the contact have to remain in the 'customer' lifecycle stage forever then in order to stay accurate on the reporting in the ad manager or only on the initial tracking and after it can be changed down the road
